member.summary: The lowest level, and includes things that sit just above transports

member.summary: The highest level, which includes an application level services, such as subscriptions

summary.para: Performs a receive from the endpoint that is specified on the bus given in the constructor. First try to do the receive, then let the endpoint/transport call (if there are consumers interested)

member.name: M:MassTransit.Context.ServiceBusReceiveContext.DeliverMessageToConsumers(MassTransit.IReceiveContext)

summary.para: Deliver the message to the consumers selected in . Assumption: the inbound transport will send the same context to this method as it did to the lambda in .
This method will try to give the message to all consumers found.

member.exception: If at least one consumer throws an exception, then a MessageException will be thrown. If multiple consumers threw exceptions, then the last exception will be the inner exception and the others won't be tracked.

member.name: T:MassTransit.Subscriptions.SubscriptionBusService
member.summary:
Manages the subscription and un subscription of message consumers to the service bus as part of the bus lifecycle.
As a bus service, once the bus is started and operational, this service will get started. At this point, any registered consumers and sagas will be subscribed to the bus.
When stop is called, those subscriptions will be removed unless the registration information indicated that the subscription is meant to be persistent, and not removed on service shutdown.

summary.para: IEndpoint is implemented by an endpoint. An endpoint is an addressable location on the network.

In MassTransit, the endpoint ties together the inbound transport, the outbound transport, the error transport that ships problematic messages to the error queue, mesage retry trackers and serialization.
It is up to the transports themselves to implement the correct connection handling and to to create the from the bytes on the wire, which hands the message over to MassTransit's internals.

summary.para: Receive from the endpoint by passing a function that can preview the message: if the caller chooses to accept it, return a method that will consume the message. The first argument of the Func is created by the transport and this is what callers of receive must inspect to find what receivers (the return value Action{IReceiveContext}) are interested in the received data.
Returns after the specified timeout if no message is available.

member.param: The function to preview/consume the message
The time to wait for a message to be available

member.summary: The default consumer pool that enqueues consumes on the thread pool.

summary.para: Start the receiving thread pool.

This method implements a message-based receive loop; so instead of having a while-loop that receives non-stop, the event channel ensures that receives are enqueued whenever is published in the event channel passed to this pool instance at construction time.
